newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan authorities detain Islamist leaders.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan authorities detain Islamist leaders.

text.p: Pakistani authorities detained the leader of the religious Jamaat-i-Islami (JI) opposition party and his deputy on Monday, as police skirmished with JI demonstrators in Islamabad and Rawalpindi, witnesses said.
They said local officials backed by dozens of armed police picked up JI leader Qazi Hussain Ahmed and his deputy Khurshid Ahmed from the latter's house in Islamabad.
"They have no written orders nor any right to arrest me..." the JI leader told reporters as he was being taken away. "Now there will be a campaign all over the country."
He said arresting Khurshid Ahmed, a member of the Senate (upper house), contravened parliamentary norms as the Senate was in session.
The JI chief was also a Senate member until he quit his seat last month as part of his struggle to oust Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto's three-year-old government for alleged corruption.

Several hundred JI demonstrators eluded police to get within a few hundred metres (yards) of parliament, where JI had planned to hold a sit-in. Police stood by as the Islamic militants blocked the city's main Jinnah Avenue and offered prayers.
